column2: This large wooden icon of a codfish has watched over rulers of Massachusetts and their courts since ancient times. It was smuggled out of Boston after the coming of the Puritains out of fear it would be destroyed by zealots.

Brown Bess, named after a legendary weapon from a great war fought long ago, in legends said across all of North America. Originally wielded by the Tycoon Elizabeth, it has since served House Thomsoter well.
